catalog_info.title: Introduction to Composition
catalog_info.notes: May not be counted for concentration credit.
catalog_info.prereq: Recommended: Some prior experience in music theory or permission of the instructor.
catalog_info.description: Open to students with little or no prior experience in composition. Explores ways of thinking about and organizing basic compositional elements such as melody, harmony, rhythm and instrumental color, as well as developing skills of score preparation and analytical listening. The primary focus of the course is a series of short compositional exercises, culminating in a somewhat longer final project. Workshop performances of students' music take place throughout the term.
